roleset.name: rave, launch into a diatribe
roleset.note: RANT-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. Member of VNcls lecture-37.11-1, manner_speaking-37.3. (from rant.01-v)
RANTING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, rant-v.01. Comparison to lecture-37.11-1, manner_speaking-37.3. (from ranting.01-n)

example.name: 'for' phrase in this case = arg3
example.text: She feels she 's showing love by bringing him to death s door because he asked for -LRB- or begged or ranted -RRB- for *RNR*-1 food-1 .

example.name: arg1 as complement clause
example.text: i showed her this and she ranted that she looked like she had no chin
example.arg: that she looked like she had no chin

example.name: standard arg3
example.text: Anne ranted about the bad service she had received at the store.
example.arg: about the bad service she had received at the store

example.name: arg0
example.text: I have no love for Bachmann and even less for Cameron , but I 'm not sure why she -LRB- or anyone else -RRB- should be expected to treat the batshitcrazy rantings of a has - been child actor like they 're super-important to the political scene .
example.arg: of a has - been child actor

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: His notion of a sustainable model for musicians is really weak and for all his ranting that the past is dead, it?s still basically the past minus recording revenues.

example.name: args 0 and 3
example.text: In his ranting about the bourgeois obsession with gold there is more than a little envy.
example.arg: about the bourgeois obsession with gold
